name: Nur Islamic School of Louisville
mission:
Our Mission
Our holistic education aims to provide the environment for the total and balanced development of every student in every sphere of learning –...
theoryOfChange: Providing a holistic environment that balances spiritual, moral, and intellectual development leads to students attaining a conscious relationship with God and becoming contributing members of society.

evaluationSources: Certified by the state of Kentucky

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 24/50: LOW Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.
components.name: Financial Health

judge_issues.message: Zakat acceptance claimed but no evidence, URL, or direct verification provided

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: NUR ISLAMIC SCHOOL OF LOUISVILLE shows strong impact and moderate alignment (minor risk deductions applied).

all_citations.claim: The charity reports a 100.0% program expense ratio, $2,796,768 in total revenue, 12.2 months of working capital, and $0.00 fundraising efficiency.
Financial data confirms total revenue of $2,796,768 and the allocation of expenses toward school programs.
The school's mission is to provide a holistic education for the total and balanced development of every student.
all_citations.source_name: Download the Automatic Checking/Savings Withdrawal Form

all_citations.claim: The institution operates as a K-12 private school with specific admission processes.
The school provides educational services spanning from early childhood through elementary and secondary levels.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 60/100 reflecting excellent financial efficiency and internal resource management, balanced against a medium data confidence level and lower donor alignment scores.
areas_for_improvement: Limited public documentation regarding long-term impact metrics and third-party outcome verifications.
Lower alignment for specialized Muslim donor segments seeking high-urgency global relief or specific advocacy niches.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The alignment score of 24/50 reflects a moderate fit; while the school serves a critical educational need within the community, it may have lower resonance for donors focused on high-urgency global crises [1][8]. The institution is categorized as sadaqah-eligible for those looking to support local Islamic education [8].
dimension_explanations.impact: The school demonstrates high operational effectiveness by maintaining a 100.0% program expense ratio and a healthy 12.2 months of working capital [1][2]. While the directness of its capacity-building model is strong, the lack of cost-per-beneficiary data results in a medium impact score of 37/50 [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: Nur Islamic School of Louisville provides a holistic educational environment dedicated to the balanced development of students from early childhood through grade 12.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 100.0%, ensuring all funds are directed toward educational services [1][2].
High fundraising efficiency with $0.00 spent to raise every $1, maximizing the impact of sadaqah contributions [1].
Strong liquidity with 12.2 months of working capital available to sustain operations [1].
baseline_narrative.summary: Located in Louisville, Kentucky, the institution operates an Early Childhood Center, an Elementary School, and a K-12 private school program [1][4]. The school's mission focuses on providing a total and balanced development for every student across all spheres of learning [3][6].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 60/100 reflecting excellent financial efficiency and internal resource management, balanced against a medium data confidence level and lower donor alignment scores.

areas_for_improvement.context: While the school has a strong mission, it currently lacks <cite id="12">publicly available beneficiary counts</cite> to assess cost-per-student effectiveness.
The organization could improve its alignment with Muslim donors by <cite id="13">clearly stating its policy on sadaqah versus other giving types</cite> on its website.

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization has not been formally evaluated by the BBB Wise Giving Alliance.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The school's long history since 1999 and consistent revenue growth mitigate some governance concerns.
case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="14">limited board size</cite> and a lack of granular impact data.

confidence.notes: Strong financial data but limited impact metrics

alignment.explanation: The school is a <cite id="1">long-standing Islamic institution</cite> that serves as a vital hub for <cite id="5">Islamic education in Kentucky</cite>.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be improved by <cite id="13">adding a dedicated giving page</cite> that clarifies the specific use of sadaqah funds.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust the institution's financial reporting as it provides <cite id="3">detailed Form 990 filings</cite> and maintains a <cite id="10">fully independent board of directors</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the school could <cite id="15">publish annual impact reports</cite> and pursue a Candid Seal of Transparency.

impact.explanation: The school demonstrates high efficiency with a <cite id="4">100% program ratio</cite> and <cite id="8">12.2 months of operating reserves</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="12">publishing student enrollment and graduation data</cite> to calculate cost-effectiveness.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Verified outcomes with implicit theory of change

rich_narrative.headline: Nur Islamic School of Louisville provides a holistic educational environment dedicated to the balanced development of students from early childhood through grade 12.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value local Islamic institutional development and want their sadaqah to support a school with zero overhead costs.
donor_motivations: Want to support holistic Islamic education for youth
Prefer organizations where 100% of funds reach the program
Value long-term community infrastructure over emergency relief
giving_considerations: The school serves a specific geographic community in Kentucky
Financial transparency is high but impact reporting is limited
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill zakat obligations or those looking for international humanitarian relief.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects verified operations and a <cite id="1">25-year track record</cite>, but lacks third-party academic evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The school creates impact by providing a <cite id="2">balanced development environment</cite> that integrates religious and secular learning.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the holistic educational model is successfully preparing students for higher education and community leadership.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Strong revenue growth and a <cite id="6">29.0% CAGR</cite> suggest the school is expanding its capacity to serve more students.

peer_comparison.differentiator: The school's <cite id="4">100% program ratio</cite> is significantly higher than the <cite id="16">peer median of 89.6%</cite>.

strengths.detail: The school maintains a <cite id="4">100.0% program expense ratio</cite> and spends <cite id="9">$0.00 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions.
The organization holds <cite id="8">12.2 months of working capital</cite>, significantly exceeding typical nonprofit benchmarks for financial health.
The institution has achieved a <cite id="6">3-year revenue CAGR of 29.0%</cite>, growing from $1.68M in 2021 to <cite id="3">$2.8M in 2023</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Nur Islamic School of Louisville stands out for its lean operational model, where <cite id="4">1.0% of expenses are dedicated to program services</cite>. This is supported by a <cite id="9">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, suggesting that the school relies on organic community support and program service revenue rather than costly marketing campaigns. Furthermore, the school's <cite id="10">100% independent board</cite> and <cite id="11">conflict of interest policy</cite> provide a strong framework for governance and accountability.
rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">1999</cite>, Nur Islamic School of Louisville is a comprehensive educational institution serving the Muslim community in Kentucky. The organization provides a <cite id="2">holistic educational environment</cite> designed for the balanced development of students from early childhood through grade 12. Financially, the school operates with a high degree of efficiency, reporting <cite id="3">$2,796,768 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. A defining characteristic of its financial model is its <cite id="4">100.0% program expense ratio</cite>, indicating that all reported functional expenses are directed toward its core educational mission. The school's curriculum integrates <cite id="5">Quran, Arabic, and Islamic Studies</cite> alongside standard Language Arts and Social Studies, ensuring students receive both religious and secular knowledge. With a <cite id="6">3-year revenue CAGR of 29.0%</cite>, the institution has demonstrated significant growth in its capacity to serve the Louisville area. Its operations are supported by a <cite id="7">100% independent board</cite>, which oversees the school's strategic direction and financial health. The institution maintains <cite id="8">12.2 months of working capital</cite>, providing a robust financial cushion that ensures operational stability even during periods of economic fluctuation.
